china.additional_styles:
<style>
        .language-selector { position: fixed; top: 20px; right: 20px; z-index: 1000; background: #ff0000; padding: 5px; border-radius: 5px; border: 2px solid #000; }
        .language-select { background: white; border: 2px solid #333; border-radius: 8px; padding: 8px 12px; font-size: 0.9rem; color: #333; cursor: pointer; min-width: 150px; font-weight: bold; }

china.body_content:
china

🇨🇳China Phone Number Generator

Generate authentic Chinese mobile and landline phone numbers. Supports all major carriers including China Mobile (中国移动), China Unicom (中国联通), and China Telecom (中国电信).

Generate China Phone Numbers

Generated Phone Numbers

0 numbers generated
No phone numbers generated yet. Click the button above to start.

About Chinese Phone Numbers

Chinese phone numbers follow a standardized format with mobile numbers typically starting with 13, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18, or 19, followed by 9 additional digits. Landline numbers vary by region with area codes ranging from 2 to 4 digits.

The major carriers in China are:

  • China Mobile (中国移动) - Largest carrier with prefixes like 134, 135, 136, 137, 138, 139, 147, 150, 151, 152, 157, 158, 159, 182, 183, 184, 187, 188, 178, 198
  • China Unicom (中国联通) - Second largest with prefixes like 130, 131, 132, 145, 155, 156, 166, 175, 176, 185, 186, 196
  • China Telecom (中国电信) - Third largest with prefixes like 133, 153, 173, 177, 180, 181, 189, 199

Usage Note

These generated numbers are for testing and development purposes only. They should not be used for actual communication attempts.

© 2024 Phone Number Generator. All rights reserved. | Privacy Policy | Terms of Service

us.body_content:
us
← Back to All Generators

🇺🇸US Phone Number Generator

Generate valid US phone numbers with proper area codes and formatting. Includes all 50 states and follows North American Numbering Plan (NANP) standards.

Generate US Phone Numbers

Generated Phone Numbers

0 numbers generated
No phone numbers generated yet. Click the button above to start.

About US Phone Numbers

US phone numbers follow the North American Numbering Plan (NANP) format: (NXX) NXX-XXXX, where N is a digit from 2-9 and X is a digit from 0-9. The first three digits represent the area code, which identifies the geographic region.

Key features of US phone numbers:

  • Area Codes: Three-digit codes that identify geographic regions
  • Exchange Codes: The first three digits after the area code
  • Subscriber Number: The last four digits that identify the specific line
  • Toll-Free Numbers: Begin with 800, 888, 877, 866, 855, 844, or 833

Usage Note

These generated numbers are for testing and development purposes only. They should not be used for actual communication attempts.

© 2024 Phone Number Generator. All rights reserved. | Privacy Policy | Terms of Service

Generated Phone Numbers

0 numbers generated
No phone numbers generated yet. Click the button above to start.

About UK Phone Numbers

UK phone numbers follow specific formatting rules with different prefixes for landlines, mobiles, and special services. The UK uses a variable-length numbering system.

Key features of UK phone numbers:

  • Landline Numbers: Begin with 01 or 02 (geographic numbers)
  • Mobile Numbers: Begin with 07 followed by 9 digits
  • Freephone Numbers: Begin with 0800 or 0808
  • Premium Rate: Begin with 09 (premium rate services)
  • Business Rate: Begin with 0845 or 0870

Usage Note

These generated numbers are for testing and development purposes only. They should not be used for actual communication attempts.

© 2024 Phone Number Generator. All rights reserved. | Privacy Policy | Terms of Service
